title: Citi Building in New York's Long Island City Earns LEED® for Existing Buildings Certification
summary: New York - Citi Realty Services announced today that it has achieved LEED-Silver for Existing Buildings certification from the U.S. Green Building Council for the One Court Square building Citi occupies in Long Island City, New York. Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) is the U.S. Green Building Council's leading rating system for designing and constructing the world's greenest, most energy efficient and high-performing buildings. The LEED for Existing Buildings (LEED EB) Rating System helps building owners and operators maximize the efficiency of existing buildings while minimizing environmental impacts.
tag-1: Citi Building in New York's Long Island City Earns LEED® for Existing Buildings Certification
tag-2: New York – Citi Realty Services announced today that it has achieved LEED-Silver for Existing Buildings certification from the U.S. Green Building Council for the One Court Square building Citi occupies in Long Island City, New York. Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) is the U.S. Green Building Council's leading rating system for designing and constructing the world's greenest, most energy efficient and high-performing buildings. The LEED for Existing Buildings (LEED EB) Rating System helps building owners and operators maximize the efficiency of existing buildings while minimizing environmental impacts.
tag-3: "Our real estate sustainability approach is aligned with our efforts to be a responsible corporate citizen, and it's also helping us control costs and increase efficiency," said John Killey, Citi Realty Services' Global Head of Building Operations. "Because of efforts like the one in the One Court Square building, we exceeded our 2011 goal to reduce operational greenhouse gas emissions by 10 percent from a 2005 baseline. That's a significant reduction, and in a big company like Citi, it can have a substantial effect on the environment."
tag-4: More than 4,300 employees work in the One Court Square building, in business units including Consumer Banking, Global Cards, Operations & Technology and Global Functions. It is one of the largest Citi sites in the New York Metro area.
tag-5: "Everyone in our building should feel proud of this certification," said Maria Veltre, Managing Director and President of Citi's One Court Square site. "LEED EB addresses whole-building maintenance and cleaning issues, recycling programs, system upgrades and more, so it requires a consistent, sustained effort from the whole team."

tag-7: Citi, which celebrates its 200th anniversary in June, has been recognized for its green efforts by Newsweek Magazine, the Dow Jones Sustainability Index, IDG's Computerworld, The Banker magazine and others.
tag-8: Other Citi projects that have received LEED certification include: the Citi Data Center in Frankfurt Germany - Platinum LEED Certification - February 2009; Citi's Singapore campus - Changi Business Park - Gold LEED Certification – February 2010; Nirlon Phase 1, Mumbai, India - LEED Platinum 2011; and Cordusio – Via Mercanti, 12 Milan, Italy – LEED Gold 2011.
